algorithms.compGeometry.convexHull

Class GrahamScanLong

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.compGeometry.convexHull.GrahamScanLong

  • public class GrahamScanLong
extends java.lang.Object
    adapted from https://code.google.com/p/two-point-correlation/source/browse/src/test/java/algorithms/compGeometry/convexHull/ under MIT License (MIT), Nichole King 2013 
      Solves the Convex Hull problem w/ a stack S of candidate points.
 
  Given a set of Q points returns the vertices of the ConvexHull(Q) in counter-clockwise
  order.   a convex hull is the smallest convex polygon that will include all points in Q.
 
  This Graham's Scan runs in O(n) due to use of a linear runtime polar angle sorter
  to reduce the allowed angles to integer degrees.
 
  It uses a technique called 'rotational sweep' to process vertices in the order
  of the polar angles they form with a reference vertex.
 
  constructed from pseudo-code in Cormen et al. "Introduction to Algorithms
    Author:
    nichole

    • Method Detail

      • computeHull

        public static GrahamScanLong.CH computeHull(long[] x,
                                            long[] y)
                                     throws GrahamScanTooFewPointsException
        find the convex hull of the given (x, y) points. Note that the resulting hull points have the same first point as last point. runtime complexity is O(N) because counting sort is used in the polar angle sort (which is O(max(N, 360)), removing the O(N*log_2(N)) component.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        convex hull of points (x, y). note that the last point equals the first point.
        Throws:
        GrahamScanTooFewPointsException
